critique: The document focuses on suspending certain employment regulations in the Canal Zone, specifically those related to compensation for skilled, technical, clerical, administrative, executive, or supervisory positions. It aims to provide flexibility in employment practices within the Canal Zone, deemed to be in the public interest. There is no explicit discussion of immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, the initial and revised scores reflect a neutral stance on these issues.
